User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

I just recently noticed that if Firefox is pinned to the Start Menu in Windows 7 it displays it's own sub-menu to open a new tab, window or start in private browsing modes. While this is great for the default Firefox shortcut, a problem arises when pinning a shortcut to the profile manager to the Start menu as well.


Actual results:

When this is done, if you have both shortcuts pinned near each other, you get some redundancy in menu options.


Expected results:

It's nice to have the added menu accessible from the Start list for the default shortcut but in the case of the Profile manager, it's unnecessary. This shortcut shouldn't have an additional menu option unless it's displaying a list of available profiles.

Alternately, it would be nice if the -p flag is set the need for a second profile manager shortcut could be rendered pointless if the same menu could also list some profile manager options in addition to the defaults.
comments.author: unattended@gmail.com
